meanings.definition: A representation or image, especially of a sacred personage.
meanings.sent1: The ancient temple was filled with eikons of gods and goddesses.
meanings.sent2: The painting of the president on the wall is an eikon of leadership.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor accidentally dropped the eikon, causing a comedic moment.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an eikon of warmth that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The eikon of the mountain on the postcard made me want to visit immediately.

meanings.definition: A visible symbol or representation of an object, concept, or person.
meanings.sent1: The dove is often seen as an eikon of peace.
meanings.sent2: The national flag is a powerful eikon of patriotism.
meanings.sent3: The giant eikon of a hamburger outside the restaurant made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed through the room, an eikon of joy.
meanings.sent5: The eikon of the heart symbolizes love in many cultures.
